alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:54PM EST until February 21 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At McConnelsville affecting Washington and Morgan Counties. For the Muskingum River...Minor flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At McConnelsville. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.6 feet, Most primary roads flooded in and between McConnelsville and Zanesville; several cottage-type homes are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.98 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Friday was 12.66 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 10.1 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM EST.
